title: Manchester United 1-1 Liverpool PLAYER RATINGS: Marcus Rashford shines as Reds midfield falters
text:
Marcus Rashford grabbed a much-needed goal to silence his critics as Manchester United stopped Liverpool's 17 game win-streak at Old Trafford.

The first-half saw VAR at centre-stage, as Rashford's tap-in opened the scoring after a long check for a foul on Divock Origi, before Sadio Mane had a goal ruled-out for handball.

Finally, in the 85th minute, Adam Lallana tapped-in the leveller to protect Liverpool's unbeaten start.

Sportsmail's DOMINIC KING ran the rule over both sides...

Manchester United ended Liverpool's 17-game winning run by holding the league leaders 1-1

MANCHESTER UNITED (3-5-2)

David De Gea - 6

Fitness scare with Spain did not stop him playing but Liverpool did not test him as much as they would have liked

Victor Lindelof - 7

Won his battle with Divock Origi, resulting in the Belgian's substitution, and was very comfortable throughout

Harry Maguire - 7

Commanding presence in the middle of the three man central defence, couldn't make his presence felt in attacking set plays

Harry Maguire was strong in a sturdy United defence but had little impact from United corners

Marcus Rojo - 6

Thrust into the starting line-up due to Axel Tuanzebe's injury and made a good contribution until switching off for equaliser

Aaron Wan-Bissaka - 7.5

Excellent performance and showed once again why United were so eager to sign him in the summer

Scott McTominay - 7

Right at the heart of United's aggressive start, put in a huge shift that was full of discipline and determination

Aaron Wan-Bissaka had an impressive game at the back, dealing well with Mane and Firmino

Fred - 6.5

Often derided since he arrived in Manchester but nothing wrong with his efforts here; went close with one late shot

Andreas Perreira - 7.5

Early tackle on Wijnaldum lifted the crowd and he caused Liverpool problems in his role as a No 10

Ashley Young - 7

Elder statesman of the team and led by example; sensible and determined play, a number of important tackles

Daniel James - 8.5

He won't forget his first appearance in this fixture in a hurry; full of life and creativity, a joy to watch at times

Marcus Rashford grabbed a much-needed goal during a sharp performance for the striker

Marcus Rashford - 8

Ran out of steam towards the end but took his goal well and his pace and drive made him a constant threat

Subs: Anthony Martial (for Rashford), Brandon Williams (for Pereira)

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer - 7 Brave call to switch to a back three but his tactics and game plan worked a treat. Would have been tough had he ended up with no points

LIVERPOOL (4-3-3)

Alisson Becker - 6

First start since the opening weekend but wasn't overly tested; no chance with United's goal

Alisson Becker made his Premier League return but didn't get to keep a clean-sheet

Trent Alexander-Arnold - 6

Use of the ball wasn't as good as normal; went close at the end with a dipping volley

Joel Matip - 7

Made a good start and won several headers but had a mid-game dip before finishing strong

Virgil van Dijk - 7

It's a long time since a striker has made him work like Rashford did; came through the test powerfully

Virgil van Dijk was put under pressure against United but handled it with his usual poise

Andrew Robertson - 7.5

Liverpool's most consistent performer through the 90 minutes and provided the assist for the equaliser

Jordan Henderson - 6

Difficult afternoon for the captain and a new position wide on the right didn't really suit him

Fabinho - 6.5

Booked for one late tackle; way off the pace in the first half but never went into hiding

Gini Wijnaldum - 5.5

Early shot made De Gea work but had one of those games when the bulk of the action passed him by

Jordan Henderson had a disjointed game as Liverpool's passing faltered at Old Trafford

Sadio Mane - 6

Will feel aggrieved to have a goal chalked off by VAR but it was right decision; didn't get too many chances

Roberto Firmino - 6.5

Erratic start, typified a wild shot, but he came through it and his running made United's defenders anxious

Divock Origi - 5.5

Should have won a free-kick immediately before United scored but didn't see enough of the ball

Sadio Mane was less influential as Liverpool faltered, the winger's goal ruled-out for handball

Subs: Oxlade-Chamberlain (for Origi) 7 Lallana (for Henderson) 7

Jurgen Klopp - 7

Disappointed with the way his team played in the opening 45 minutes but kept making changes to ensure they got back into the game; each substitution paid dividends

Referee Martin Atkinson - 5.5

He got the big call wrong when failing to spot Origi had been fouled by Lindelof when in an excellent position. Not a good day for the Premier League's most experienced official
description: Marcus Rashford grabbed a much-needed goal to silence his critics as Manchester United stopped Liverpool's 17 game win-streak at Old Trafford as the Reds' midfield faltered.
